Reviews.Title: Good, entry-level phone that is gimped by low storage
Reviews.Author: Benjamin K. Gifford
Reviews.Content: I have been using this phone for a few weeks and have been fairly pleased. It definitely has a bit of a "wow" factor based on its small size, nicely contoured shape, and somewhat unique color. It is generally responsive and makes calls well. The battery life is on the very high end compared to other Android phones I've used.Don't expect to be gaming a lot because the processor is fairly slow. Cut the Rope runs okay, but there is occasional slow down.Also, Netflix playback is choppy to the point of being unwatchable. However, video from Youtube plays just fine.It comes with HTC Sense, so take that for what you will. Personally, I like it because it is pleasing to the eye and makes some tasks very simple.This phone has one GLARING problem, and that's the internal storage. The phone has 512mb of storage build in, which sounds like plenty. However, the Android OS, Sense, Sense updates, and pre-installed apps (though there aren't too many) only leave the user with 30-40 megs of free space. Also, if the phone gets to around 10-12 megs free, it will stop syncing Google accounts, which limits the user to really only 20-30 usable megs. Many apps can be moved to the SD card, but not all of them. Keep in mind that you may have to strip down to the bare essentials.

Reviews.Title: Not international version
Reviews.Author: Tulia Cortes "Tulipan"
Reviews.Content: THIS ITEM IS A CDMA, ONLY TO USE WITH VIRGIN MOBILE CARRIER, DON'T BUY IT IF YOU ARE IN ANOTHER COUNTRY BECAUSE IT WON'T WORK....

Reviews.Title: Pitiful battery life and internal memory
Reviews.Author: Brian520
Reviews.Content: Only came with 150MB usable internal memory. This is not even enough to update pre-installed bloatware apps that are impossible to get rid of even when connected to the computer. Any app I downloaded had to immediately be moved to SD card, couldn't move all apps to SD card - even ones I downloaded. Could only take a handful of pictures without having to upload/delete them.On top of this all, every time after making a phone call the Dialer process keeps running and draining battery life like crazy, even a restart doesn't always fix it. Even if it did, what good is it if you have to restart it after every phone call?Maybe it's a cheap, small smartphone, but pitifully small internal memory, and terrible battery life makes it a pain to use. Save the trouble of having to return it, and don't buy it.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely the worst phone I have ever owned.
Reviews.Author: J. Lazarus
Reviews.Content: No question about it. Don't buy this phone. The reception is poor and unreliable. The speaker phone at top volume setting is almost a whisper. With only three applications loaded I regularly get a message that the memory is low. Not to mention I have the misfortune to have chosen Metro PCS for my service. I usually have 1 bar, if that. All in all a bad experience. I bought the HTC Wildfire S phone because of the HTC name....a big mistake. Don't waste your hard earned money on this piece of trash.

Reviews.Title: JUNK!!! DO NOT PURCHASE!!!
Reviews.Author: PJN
Reviews.Content: This is the worst phone ever created...No battery life, small and frustrating screen, will turn itself off and won't come back on, power button works only when it wants to, absolutely no volume, etc, etc, etc...All I want to do is smash it with a sledgehammer...You've been warned...

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Marty S.
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect, it came in a factory sealed box and the setup was super easy!  This phone was for my wife and she loves it.

Reviews.Title: Internal memory too low
Reviews.Author: Vitus Osae
Reviews.Content: Phone was received with low internal memory of 150MB and no external SD card which makes it not very exciting but it's ok overall

Reviews.Title: Poor battery life and horrible storage!
Reviews.Author: Inese.
Reviews.Content: This phone is horrible. It is difficult to add apps to the phone because the internal memory sucks. The phone has many apps that I have no use for and deleting them is difficult. The battery dies quickly and I suspect that the many unnecessary apps adds to this problem. The camera works fairly well.

Reviews.Title: Best order ever!
Reviews.Author: Angel s
Reviews.Content: I had my htc wildfire s stolen on wednesday oct 10 after finding out the phone was discontinued i paniced trying to find another one after searching and searching all day i finally found this one! I thought it wouldnt be here till at least oct 16th but it arrived saturday oct 13th. Not only was it in PERFECT condition, amazingly priced, and early; it also came with the phone case i had on my wish list and 3 extra screen protectors. Im so happy with my purchase! Best order ever!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product, I loved it though I can't use its charger
Reviews.Author: Leo
Reviews.Content: I'm from Venezuela and this phone looks great, I love it, it comes almost ready-to-use... The only minus is the charger, I can't use this type of charger in my country and there is no adapter that fits to the plug. BUT: I bought an universal HTC charger and it solved the problem...Soy de Venezuela y este teléfono luce genial, me encanta, viene casi listo para usar. Lo único que no me gustó fue el cargador, no puedo usar este tipo de cargador en mi país y no hay adaptador que le quede. PERO: Compré un cargador universal HTC y esto resolvió el problema...

Reviews.Title: Very crappy phone
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I hate this phone. I brought it two years ago from best buy when it was $200. I have the prepaid coverage from Virgin Mobile. I had this phone for not even a year until I had to get a new one. I got a new one, but for free since I had a protection plan on it. The second one didn't even last a year like the last one as it gave me sooooo many problems. It has too many pointless apps that are built in and you can't take it off, the phone storage is low, the battery life doesn't last long, it freezes too much and now my phone doesn't even want to turn on. I haven't even been able to use it in 2 weeks and now I need a new phone. Definately not buying this crap again. DO NOT BUY THIS PHONE AT ALL COSTS!

Reviews.Title: Isn't even suitable for beginners.
Reviews.Author: Yanique
Reviews.Content: This phone has a horrible battery life and even worse storage space. Only buy this phone if you don't expect to do anything but expect calls. Don't expect to have more than 2 major apps. The less than 150mb storage space is a cruel joke and the ton of bloatware makes it worse. Audio is poor. On the plus side, picture quality is surprisingly okay.

Reviews.Title: Worst phone I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: Katie-Bell
Reviews.Content: I'm not one to go for the big fancy phones, so when I got this back in the summer of 2011 it was small and compact. It was just the right size to slip into my pocket, though bulky once I got the rubber case for it (it's slippery otherwise). But even for someone like me who appreciates the smaller phones, I know a crappy phone when I see one.Oh how I hate this phone. Despite the fact that it's survived a drop in water, been thrown to the floor by my toddler countless times, thrown against the wall in anger, and is still going after two years is actually pretty impressive. But don't let it's durability get to you. It's the most frustrating phone I've ever owned. Let me make a list of all the things wrong about this phone.-First and foremost, is the memory, or should I say LACK of memory? This was the first phone I ever owned that actually had apps on it. And yet I could never hold more than two or three on this phone. The internal memory is so awful that I have to delete updates from running software that I don't use but can't be deleted just to get some memory in order to get into my pictures to delete them so I can get MORE memory. I have NO apps on this phone. I only use it for internet (which can't be accessed if the memory gets too low, in which I have to clear more space),  pictures (which starts to be too much for the memory at about 72 pics) and talking and texting. Bottom line, the memory SUCKS. If you want a smaller, older phone but want apps, DON'T get this.-Battery. This phone has gone through two chargers, and after two years will no longer charge all the way anymore. My battery is almost dead by evening. I usually always have to plug it into its charger at least once a day after it's charged all night. It's horrible.-Texting. I'm used to texting fast, but this phone doesn't seem to be able to be at the same pace as me. I use the predict text because I'm so used to it, and if I didn't, I'd be texting twice as long because the letters are too small and I end up hitting another letter next to the one I meant to hit, so I use predict text. If you text too fast it'll gives some pretty strange words, such as "dAOding" and random crap like that. The predict text needs to take some english classes, it doesn't know the proper usage for sentences. Ex: using "were" when I'm trying to say "we're" and vice versa. Texting on this phone will give you a headache, and will easily turn your 1 minute of texting into a 5 minute anger fest as you try to text the right thing.-Camera. The camera was good when I first got the phone, but wear has no doubt made it fuzzy, foggy, washed out, etc. It takes decent pics but if you're looking to capture some heartfelt moments with friends or family, don't use the camera.-Cases, or lack of. I had three other family members who owned this phone when it came out, and none of us could ever find a case for it, because there basically weren't any. A couple of cellular places in the mall had some, in a box under the counter. I had a choice between three cases and went with the ugly black rubber one because it was the only one that would protect my phone. And, well, the case actually has served its purpose, and because of the rubber case it's actually expanded the life of this phone. So if you do, for whatever reason, get this phone, don't count on finding a decent case for it.-I don't know about others, but this phone will randomly go white and the HTC logo will come up, as if it's just crashed. Phone has to be restarted regularly to function better.Overall, this phone just isn't worth it. If you don't care for apps, if you'd rather just browse internet and take a few pics now and then, then you might want this phone. But if you're an avid internet surfer, you may want to look elsewhere. The horrible memory and battery life will have you thrashing this phone against the wall before you know it.

Reviews.Title: exactly what I expected.
Reviews.Author: Jose Antonio Arcoverde
Reviews.Content: I ordered this item for my sun in Brazil. It works perfectly there. He is very happy. It works exactly like I expected.

Reviews.Title: HTC Wildfire S A510e
Reviews.Author: Lizette U. Thomas "L.Thomas"
Reviews.Content: Im so in love with this phone,the features are really really great,but i wish i had the torch light like other phones have.

Reviews.Title: Brillant Phone.
Reviews.Author: Adam.
Reviews.Content: HTC Wildfire S, Good Phone, Reasonable Price, all in I'd reccomend it to anyone who wants an android phone for whatever reason, I've ran into no problems with mine so far, had it for 8 months. 5 Star

Reviews.Title: Woeful Battery Life
Reviews.Author: George W. Noble "IndoScot"
Reviews.Content: The HTC Wildfire S must be one of the most impractical pieces of portable equipment ever produced. The battery life is so short it is really only of much use if you are permanently close to a wall socket or USB power supply. Mine can barely hold a charge overnight with all possible apps shut down.

Reviews.Title: this phone sucks
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: this phone sucks had it for a month it freezes. signal always drop rearly goes on 3g. can't send picture mail.

Reviews.Title: HTC Wilfire S A510e
Reviews.Author: Morgan25
Reviews.Content: Hi people,take care about this item, its come without spanish language, its come only with english languaje not others!, and this thing its comes with WCDMA not HSDPA :( not 3g network for me, so again take care about this product.
